qas.question: What is the informal name of The National Archives Building?
On what street is the The National Archives Building located?
Where is the Declaration of Independence kept?
Where in the National Archives can you view a copy of the Magna Carta?
Where is the Louisiana Purchase Treaty kept?
In what year was the Emancipation Proclamation written?

plausible_answers.text: the main chamber of the National Archives

qas.question: Where is a statue of Edward I located?
What did Edward I like to have a collection of?
What document was written by Edward I in 1297?

plausible_answers.text: the Declaration of Independence, the Constitution, and the Bill of Rights

qas.question: What documents are kept at the National Mall?

context: <a2_0><a4_0>The National Archives Building<a4_0/><a2_0/>, known informally as <a0_0>Archives I<a0_0/>, located north of the National Mall on <a1_0>Constitution Avenue<a1_0/> in Washington, D.C., opened as its original headquarters in <b5_0>1935<b5_0/>. It holds the original copies of the three main formative documents of the United States and its government: <b9_0>the Declaration of Independence, the Constitution, and the Bill of Rights<b9_0/>. It also hosts a copy of the 1297 <b8_0>Magna Carta<b8_0/> confirmed by Edward I. These are displayed to the public in <b6_0>the <a3_0>main chamber<a3_0/> of the National Archives<b6_0/>, which is called the Rotunda for the Charters of Freedom. The National Archives Building also exhibits other important American historical documents such as the Louisiana Purchase Treaty, the Emancipation Proclamation, and collections of photography and other historically and culturally significant <b7_0>American artifacts<b7_0/>.
